DOC.brief_title: Perinatal Outcomes Nutritionally Monitored Obese Pregnant Women
DOC.detailed_description: Study Population Selection : This study recruit 200 obese pregnant woman 12 28 week gestation body mass index ( BMI ) great 29.9 kg/m2 . Women eligible pregnant single fetus , free diabetes , hypertension , chronic kidney disease recruitment . Methodology : The patient randomize either traditional monitored group . All participant counsel least regard conventional prenatal nutrition guideline . A detailed dietary intake protocol would do intervention ( monitor ) group , would include place balanced nutritional intake regimen 18-24 kcal/kg/day ( less 2000 calorie ) . Each patient ask record diary food eats day , review investigator assignee prenatal visit . The patient weigh prenatal visit monitor patient weigh blind actual weight . Data analysis : The two group compare respect pregnancy weight gain , proportion excessive weight gain ( great 15 pound ) , maternal morbidity , intrapartum complication newborn birthweight . The primary analysis consist two sample t-test comparing monitor versus non-monitored group regard weight gain delivery . A secondary analysis use repeat measure ANOVA look weight gain two group baseline 6 week post partum order look trends time . Tests mean contrast compare difference two group time post pregnancy relative baseline . Additional analysis do look outcome . In case continuous variable outcome ( e.g. , gestational weight ) , student 's t-test use . categorical outcome ( e.g. , macrosomia ) , chi square test use comparison . Alpha 0.05 comparison .
DOC.criteria: BMI great 29.9 kg/m2 Single fetus Diabetes Hypertension chronic kidney disease
